episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and humorous facts, including the likelihood of falling down stairs based on marital status, a punny tanning salon name, a wartime shoe rationing plan, and etiquette classes for young children.

facts.fact: Unmarried people are more likely to fall down stairs than married people, and previously married people fall down more than both of them.
There's a tanning salon in St. Andrews called Sun Tandrews.
During the Second World War, the US government considered making all American shoes deliberately ugly.
The etiquette experts de Bretts run classes that teach five-year-olds to have strong handshakes and navigate dinner parties.
